About Me

Mechanical engineer focused on hands-on prototyping, test engineering, and first‑principles design. I build, break, instrument, and iterate—then translate prototypes into production‑ready hardware and drawings.

Recently: CRAB Lab robotic centipede autonomy & sensing; GT Solar Racing mechanical lead; and composite materials testing.

Why Anduril: mission‑driven hardware, fast iteration, and real‑world impact. Strong fit for roles that require design→test→production ownership, high‑quality CAD & drawings, and shop‑floor execution.

Logistics: U.S. person; Atlanta‑onsite; ready for full‑time 2026 start.
Interests: test engineering, robotics, reliability, field validation.

Targeted Highlights

Hardware, Test & First Principles

  • Design→prototype→analyze failures→productionize workflows (DHF/ECN discipline).
  • First‑principles stress, stiffness, dynamics; verify with calcs, FEA, and bench tests.
  • CAD & drawings (GD&T; tolerances; materials; finish; stack‑ups; BOM ownership).
  • Shop skills: 3D printing, laser/waterjet, sheet metal, basic machining & assembly.

Electrical Integration & Sensing

  • Integrated motors, controllers, IMUs, encoders, cameras, custom force sensors.
  • Data acquisition, test fixtures, and Python tooling for sensor fusion & test automation.

Field & Vendor Execution

  • Build test plans, run instrumented tests, analyze results, and close out with corrective actions.
  • Vendor bring‑up, DFM notes, drawing packs, and quick‑turn iterations.

Projects

Robotic Centipede — CRAB Lab (Georgia Tech)

Undergraduate researcher in design, sensing, and autonomy for multi‑legged, elongate robots

  • Mechanical design & rapid prototyping of body/leg modules; additive, sheet metal, laser/waterjet.
  • Closed‑loop control on Raspberry Pi; IMU, encoder & camera integration; Python/C++ control stack.
  • Custom contact sensors (capacitance/force) and a 6‑axis arm test rig for drag‑force studies.
  • Outcome: reliable lab platforms + data pipelines for gait experiments and planning research.

Mechanical Lead — Georgia Tech Solar Racing

Mechanical lead for a road‑worthy, multi‑occupant solar vehicle to race across the U.S.

  • Frame, aero, steering, suspension design & integration; 1000s‑part SolidWorks assembly ownership.
  • First‑principles + FEA (ANSYS/NX) with physical test rigs to validate/repair suspension failures.
  • Composite chassis design; DFM with in‑house processes; drawing packs & vendor coordination.

Composite Materials Characterization

ASTM‑based test program for in‑house carbon sandwich panels and fiber layups

  • Designed compression, 4‑pt bend, tension, joint tests; standardized prep & fixturing.
  • Processed thousands of data points in MATLAB; produced datasheet‑level properties for design.
  • Correlated ANSYS Composite Pre/Post with test results to set design factors of safety.
